Name: market for gravel, round | gravel, round | EN15804GD, U
Category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay
Description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/15220/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'gravel, round', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;The product "gravel, round" represents round gravel, which is co-produced with sand in the same process. The module corresponds to the production of 1 kg of sand (35%) and gravel (65%). The largest use of construction sand and gravel is as aggregate for the production of concrete. The second largest use is as foundation material for highways, railways, runways, etc. Other major uses include aggregate for hot mix asphalt, and filler for highway, dam, and other back-filling. Smaller volumes of construction sand and gravel are used in plaster and gunite sands, snow and ice control, and railroad ballast. The amounts of reference products were expressed relative to the production volumes.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'gravel, round',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'gravel, round',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
